awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences:  Cyclic Homology, Higher Indices and Secondary Invariants
awd_abstract_narration: Professor Moscovici will exploit the tools of non-commutative              differential geometry and of non-commutative harmonic analysis for              the investigation of differential and topological invariants of                 multiply connected manifolds.  The first part of his project                    concerns invariants of index type and is a continuation of his work             on the Novikov conjecture.  The second part, which represents a new             line of research, deals with the more subtle secondary-type                     invariants (e.g. analytic torsion and the eta invariant) and aims               to place them in the framework of cyclic (co)homology and algebraic             K-theory.                                                                            A manifold is the generalization to higher dimensions of a                 smooth two dimensional surface.  For example, the space-time                    continuum is a four dimension manifold.  Professor Moscovici's                  research is aimed at understanding these geometric objects by                   exploiting connections with the theory of linear transformations                (infinite matrices) in infinite dimensional spaces.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
